timeline.message:
Stop requiring GDK_HOME

Since CUDA 8.0 nvml.h is part of the CUDA toolkit rather than
a separate package.

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

timeline.bodyText:
I guess the $(GDK_HOME) in this line is no longer needed.
(Edit) Still needed for older CUDA versions?
timeline.author: knn-k
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -60,10 +60,6 @@ ifdef ENABLE_GPU
         $(error You must set CUDA_HOME if ENABLE_GPU is set)
     endif
 
-    ifeq (,$(GDK_HOME))
-        $(error You must set GDK_HOME if ENABLE_GPU is set)
-    endif
-
     PRODUCT_INCLUDES+=$(CUDA_HOME)/include $(CUDA_HOME)/nvvm/include $(GDK_HOME)

replies.bodyText: It's not a problem if GDK_HOME is empty.
replies.author: keithc-ca

replies.bodyText: Yes, it's still needed for versions 7.5 or older, in which case you'll get a compile error (if it's not set reasonably).
replies.author: keithc-ca
